Just discovered this trick. 

DOWNLOAD ALL STATE FORMS YOU NEED *F-r-e-e

-Install TTax2010
-Opt for automatic updates

DO NOT START THE APP YET. 

-go to RegEdit (type that into search/run bar in windows)
-go to HKEY_CURRENT_USER>Software>Intuit>TY10
-in window on right, right-click, select new>string value.

-heres the fun part. take your state's 2 letter abbr, encapsulate it inside 'w[insert 2 letter abbr here]iper'. ex. CA state would be 'wcaiper'. (make sure its lowercase). 

-double click new value and enter '1' in data field. 

-start up TTax2010
-scan for new updates (it should ask to do this automatically) or go to Online>Check for updates

*note - messing with registry values can mess up your pc. dont go fooling around in there.
